snippet: The producer Scott Rudin has dropped out of his involvement with "Clybourne Park," expected to open on Broadway in April and contend for the 2012 Tony Award for best play.
abstract: The producer Scott Rudin has dropped out of his involvement with "Clybourne Park," expected to open on Broadway in April and contend for the 2012 Tony Award for best play.
lead_paragraph: 6:23 p.m. | Updated The producer Scott Rudin is known around Broadway and Hollywood for both superb taste and an expectation that his colleagues - actors, directors, publicists, fellow producers - will submit to his wishes. The playwright Bruce Norris is known in theater circles in New York and Chicago (where he long lived) for being blunt and contrarian - in real life as well as in stage dialogue - and for "his disdain for stooping to those in power," as the theater critic of The Chicago Tribune put it.

headline.main: Falling-Out Imperils Broadway Production of 'Clybourne Park'
